@graph.name: Parks Core
@graph.description: Categorization of amusement parks based on their core activities: Attractions, Exhibitions, Shows, Wildlife.

hasBranch.name: Attractions
hasBranch.description: Parks filled with mechanical rides, roller coasters, water slides, and themed areas designed for entertainment and thrill.

example.name: Thrill Kingdom
example.description: Featuring some of the world's most extreme roller coasters, family-friendly rides, and immersive themed lands.

hasBranch.name: Exhibitions
hasBranch.description: Parks specializing in exhibitions, such as interactive science centers, art galleries, and historical museums.

example.name: Discovery Dome
example.description: Features hands-on science exhibits, planetarium shows, and art installations that encourage curiosity and learning.

hasBranch.name: Shows
hasBranch.description: Parks primarily offering live shows, including musical performances, theater productions, and educational demonstrations.

example.name: Spectacle Island
example.description: Home to award-winning theatrical performances, live music shows, and cultural festivals that entertain and educate.

hasBranch.name: Wildlife
hasBranch.description: Parks that focus on providing experiences with animals and nature, often including zoos, safari parks, and marine life parks.

example.name: Global Wildlife Center
example.description: A vast reserve where visitors can interact with and observe animals in settings that mimic their natural habitats, promoting conservation and education.
